course_title: Special Topics in Religion: Religion and Social Memory
class_notes:
(Same as ANT 2851, HIST 296 2, and LACS 270 3)
This course will be taught online. It meets for one synchronous 75-minute session per week on Thursdays. The rest of the material will be delivered asynchronously.
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Theme, Region.
Throughout Latin American history, heroes and martyrs have played a crucial role in the creation of unifying national narratives. At the same time, they have often become the source of discord, as different groups disagreed over what and who should be remembered as heroic and exemplary. This course will explore some of these debates by focusing on the representation of exemplary lives in the region through a variety of means, including photography, monuments, museums, archives, ceremonials, and rituals. Among the topics to be addressed are: modernity, nation building, social rebellion, and accountability.
course_description: Variety of subjects pertaining to religion. Content will vary in successive offerings. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
